column4: what is the command to exit out of desktop environment so that you can log in a different desktop environment
what is the command to exit out of desktop environment so that you can log in a different desktop environment
just click the log out button in your panel
i would have done that if I could
why can't you?
i am stuck in a desktop environment that doesn't work
what desktop environment?
KDE
i want to exit out but there is no option
try #kubuntu
tell me the command to get out
I don't know it for kde
me neither that is why someone must help!!
you could just ctrl-alt-f1 and kill your user, but #kubuntu may know a more elegant way
what is the command for killing the user?
you may use some incantation of pkill for example
tell me the command!!
I suggested you try #kubuntu, did they know a better way?
ok how about this tell me the command to restart the damn system
nevermind
if you have a shell, then your best bet is to find the equivalent of gnome-session-save on kde (ask #kubuntu), if you just want to reboot « sudo reboot ».  If both of those fail, what itheos said
